doc.title: VideoOverlay
doc.desc:
The VideoOverlay class is a class for creating a display area to show MPEG I, WMV, H.264, Theora, etc. It can also display on Kirikiri layers. Prior to version 1.3.0, krmovie.dll was required in the same location as the Kirikiri executable to play WMV/MPEG I. From version 1.3.0 onwards, krmovie.dll was integrated into the main body, so it is no longer necessary to attach it separately. To play Theora, krdstheora.dll is required.
Except for playback on layers, in overlay playback, the VideoOverlay class display area is displayed in front of all layers and cannot be transparent. Playback on layers tends to have a higher processor load during playback compared to overlay playback.

member.name: VideoOverlay

argitem.name: window
argitem.desc: Specifies the window (Window class object) that will own this layer.

member.desc: Constructs a VideoOverlay class object.

member.name: onStatusChanged

argitem.name: status
argitem.desc: Represents the status string. It is one of the following. "unload" : Media is not open "ready" : Media preparation is complete "play" : Media is playing "stop" : Media is stopped "pause" : Media is paused

member.desc: Occurs when the status of this object changes. "ready" only occurs in vomMFEVR mode.

member.name: onPeriod

argitem.name: type
argitem.desc: Represents the type of Period event. It is one of the following. perLoop : Reached the end of a (normal) loop perSegLoop : Reached the end of a segment loop perPeriod : Reached the frame specified by the setPeriodEvent method perPrepare : Playback preparation by the prepare method is complete

member.desc: This method is called when the end of a loop or a frame specified by setPeriodEvent is reached, or when playback preparation is completed by the prepare method. When this event is called upon reaching the end of a loop or a frame specified by setPeriodEvent, the playback position may have already exceeded the specified position depending on the playback situation. Refer to the frame property to get the actual current playback position.

member.name: onFrameUpdate
member.desc: Method called after a video frame is updated. The frame argument does not necessarily match the currently displayed video frame exactly. Available only in layer rendering mode or mixer mode.

member.name: open
member.desc: Opens the specified media. Playable formats in the current version are MPEG I (extensions .mpeg, .mpg, or .mpv) and WMV. For video-only (not multiplexed with audio) MPEG I streams, please use the .mpv extension.

member.name: play
member.desc: Starts media playback.

member.name: stop
member.desc: Stops media playback.

member.name: pause
member.desc: Pauses media playback.

member.name: rewind
member.desc: Moves the media playback position to the beginning.

member.name: prepare
member.desc: Draws the first frame of the media to the specified layer and triggers an onPeriod event when drawing is finished. After calling the prepare method, wait for the onPeriod event before starting playback.

member.name: setSegmentLoop

argitem.name: comeFrame
argitem.desc: Loop destination frame (loop start frame). When playback reaches goFrame, the playhead moves to this frame.

argitem.name: goFrame
argitem.desc: Loop end frame (loop terminal frame). When the display of the frame immediately preceding this frame ends, the playhead moves to comeFrame.

member.desc: Performs loop processing between specified frames. An onPeriod event occurs at the loop end (goFrame). A keyframe must be set in the movie file for the comeFrame. If not set, the playback position will move to the keyframe closest to the specified frame when moving from the loop end to the start.

member.name: cancelSegmentLoop
member.desc: Cancels the inter-segment loop specified by the setSegmentLoop method.

member.name: close
member.desc: Closes the media. Also releases all resources allocated for playing the media.

member.name: setPeriodEvent
member.shortdesc: Specify event occurrence at a specific frame

argitem.name: eventFrame
argitem.desc: Specifies the frame to trigger the onPeriod event.

member.desc: Triggers an onPeriod event at the specified frame. Once the onPeriod event occurs, it is cleared. To trigger it again, set it again using this method.

member.name: cancelPeriodEvent
member.shortdesc: Cancel event occurrence at a specific frame
member.desc: Cancels the event occurrence set by the setPeriodEvent method.

member.name: setPos
member.shortdesc: Specify the top-left position of the playback rectangle

argitem.name: left
argitem.desc: Specifies the left edge position of the rectangular area for media playback.

argitem.name: top
argitem.desc: Specifies the top edge position of the rectangular area for media playback.

member.desc: Specifies the top-left position of the rectangular area for media playback. Coordinates are within the window client (the area where layers can be displayed) and are specified in pixels.

member.name: setSize
member.shortdesc: Specify the size of the playback rectangle

argitem.name: width
argitem.desc: Specifies the width of the rectangular area for media playback.

argitem.name: height
argitem.desc: Specifies the height of the rectangular area for media playback.

member.desc: Specifies the size of the rectangular area for media playback in pixels. In the current version, this method cannot be used during layer playback.

member.name: setBounds
member.shortdesc: Specify the position and size of the playback rectangle

argitem.name: left
argitem.desc: Specifies the left edge position of the rectangular area for media playback.

argitem.name: top
argitem.desc: Specifies the top edge position of the rectangular area for media playback.

argitem.name: width
argitem.desc: Specifies the width of the rectangular area for media playback.

argitem.name: height
argitem.desc: Specifies the height of the rectangular area for media playback.

member.desc: Specifies the position and size of the rectangular area for media playback. Coordinates are within the window client (the area where layers can be displayed) and are specified in pixels. In the current version, only the position can be specified with this method during layer playback; the size is ignored.

member.name: selectAudioStream
member.desc: Enables the specified audio stream number. Cannot be used with videos that do not contain multiple audio streams.

member.name: setMixingLayer
member.desc: Mixes the specified layer with the video. Mixing is performed with the layer image at the time this method is called. To reflect updates to the layer image, this method must be called again. By using VideoOverlay.onFrameUpdate to check if the layer image has been updated and then calling this method, updates will be reflected automatically. Calling this method every frame in onFrameUpdate will impose a significant load, so it is better to avoid doing so. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: resetMixingLayer
member.desc: Cancels the mixing of video and layer. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: position
member.desc: Represents the media playback position in ms. The value can also be set.

member.name: frame
member.desc: Represents the media playback position in frames. The value can also be set.

member.name: loop
member.desc: Represents whether loop playback is enabled or disabled. The value can also be set. If true, it loops; if false, it does not.

member.name: width
member.desc: Represents the width of the playback rectangle. The value can also be set. This property cannot be used during layer playback in the current version (the size will always be the same as the video size).

member.name: height
member.desc: Represents the height of the playback rectangle. The value can also be set. This property cannot be used during layer playback in the current version (the size will always be the same as the video size).

member.name: left
member.shortdesc: Left edge position of the playback rectangle
member.desc: Represents the left edge position of the playback rectangle. The value can also be set.

member.name: top
member.shortdesc: Top edge position of the playback rectangle
member.desc: Represents the top edge position of the playback rectangle. The value can also be set.

member.name: visible
member.desc: Specifies whether the playback area is visible. The value can also be set. If true, it is visible; if false, it is invisible.

member.name: fps
member.desc: Represents the frame rate (frames/second).

member.name: numberOfFrame
member.desc: Represents the total number of frames.

member.name: totalTime
member.desc: Represents the total time in ms.

member.name: layer1
member.desc: Represents the layer to be drawn in layer rendering mode. The value can also be set. By setting the layer1 and layer2 properties to different layers, the same video can be displayed on two layers simultaneously.

member.name: layer2
member.desc: Represents the layer to be drawn in layer rendering mode. The value can also be set.

member.name: mode
member.shortdesc: Specification of overlay or layer rendering
member.desc: Represents whether it is in overlay mode, layer rendering mode, mixer mode, or Media Foundation mode. The value can also be set. It will be vomOverlay for overlay mode, vomLayer for layer rendering mode, vomMixer for mixer mode, and vomMFEVR for Media Foundation mode. vomMFEVR mode can only be used in version 1.2.0 or later.

member.name: playRate
member.desc: Sets the playback rate of the media. Specifying 1.0 results in normal playback speed, 0.5 is half speed, and 2 is double speed. Settable values depend on the DirectShow filter. Reference: For MPEG files with audio, values from greater than 0.0 up to 2.0 can be set. For MPEG files without audio, values from greater than 0.0 within the range of a double (probably) can be set, but the actual playback speed is limited by the processing speed.

member.name: segmentLoopStartFrame
member.desc: The start frame of the segment loop.

member.name: segmentLoopEndFrame
member.desc: The start frame of the segment loop.

member.name: periodEventFrame
member.desc: The frame that triggers the period event. If not set, it will be a negative value.

member.name: audioBalance
member.desc: Represents the pan (sound image position). The value can also be set. You can specify the left and right positions where the sound is heard. Specify a value from -100000 to 0 to 100000, where -100000 is completely left, 0 is center, and 100000 is completely right. When playing a stereo source, panning is achieved by attenuating either the left or right channel (specifying 0 outputs both channels, and specifying -100000 outputs only the left channel).

member.name: audioVolume
member.desc: Represents the playback volume. The value can also be set. Specify a value from 0 to 100000, where 0 is complete mute and 100000 is 100% volume.

member.name: numberOfAudioStream
member.desc: Available only for MPEG files. Gets the number of audio streams.

member.name: enabledAudioStream
member.desc: Available only for MPEG files. Gets the audio stream number targeted for playback. Returns -1 if no audio stream is found.

member.name: mixingMovieAlpha
member.desc: Represents the transparency of the video in the range of 0.0 (completely transparent) to 1.0 (completely opaque). Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: mixingMovieBGColor
member.desc: Represents the background color of the video. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: contrastRangeMin
member.desc: Represents the minimum value of the contrast range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: contrastRangeMax
member.desc: Represents the maximum value of the contrast range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: contrastDefaultValue
member.desc: Represents the default contrast value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: contrastStepSize
member.desc: Represents the valid increment from contrastRangeMin to contrastRangeMax. Contrast can be changed in units of this value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: contrast
member.desc: Represents the video contrast. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: brightnessRangeMin
member.desc: Represents the minimum value of the brightness range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: brightnessRangeMax
member.desc: Represents the maximum value of the brightness range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: brightnessDefaultValue
member.desc: Represents the default brightness value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: brightnessStepSize
member.desc: Represents the valid increment from brightnessRangeMin to brightnessRangeMax. Brightness can be changed in units of this value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: brightness
member.desc: Represents the video brightness. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: hueRangeMin
member.desc: Represents the minimum value of the hue range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: hueRangeMax
member.desc: Represents the maximum value of the hue range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: hueDefaultValue
member.desc: Represents the default hue value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: hueStepSize
member.desc: Represents the valid increment from hueRangeMin to hueRangeMax. Hue can be changed in units of this value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: hue
member.desc: Represents the video hue. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: saturationRangeMin
member.desc: Represents the minimum value of the saturation range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: saturationRangeMax
member.desc: Represents the maximum value of the saturation range. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: saturationDefaultValue
member.desc: Represents the default saturation value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: saturationStepSize
member.desc: Represents the valid increment from saturationRangeMin to saturationRangeMax. Saturation can be changed in units of this value. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: saturation
member.desc: Represents the video saturation. Available only in mixer mode.

member.name: originalWidth
member.desc: The width of the stored video.

member.name: originalHeight
member.desc: The height of the stored video.
